title: (x) Carribean Stud - Tango {James}
content:
Anybody know the font used in the logo for Caribbean Stud Poker logo?   
   
 [http://www.acgames.com/games/carribeanstud.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121095151/http:/www.acgames.com/games/carribeanstud.jpg)

 [‹ (x) stencil "e" - VSV Bypass Stencil Bold {Maria Ribera}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121095151/http:/www.typophile.com/node/5357 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Pacific Basin Shipping - Optima {Marc O} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121095151/http:/www.typophile.com/node/5349 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content: That's [Tango](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121095151/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/tango/tango/testdrive.html?s=CARIBBEAN%2BSTUD&p=60). I assume that's the one you were intrested in. The other one is perhaps [Twentieth Century](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121095151/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/twentieth-century-mt/).
That's definitely Tango -- and that game is a sucker bet, too. i'd avoid it at all costs. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121095151im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Agreed its Tango. Most of those new poker variations are sucker games. But i'm doing design work for a gaming website, not playing.   
   
Thanks gents!
